description.narrative: Project support for Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) staff, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, the prevalence of diarrhea is reduced by 15% and the incidence of helminth infections reduced by 10% and at least 30% of parents, guardians, heads of families and children wash their hands with soap and water at crucial moments, consume drinking safe water and know how to treat water at their home before consumption and use hygienic

description.narrative: The WASH programme has started with a total of 9 staff members in Conakry (3) and in the 3 sub-offices (6). One new staff IP, TA has joined the team in March 2017 to support the program implementation and the national officers s based in sub-offices. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2017
